title: 'Russians are even trying to ban our holidays' - women speak out from occupied Ukraine
snippets: Ukrainians in Russian-held land tell the BBC about the difficulties of life under occupation.
summary: Ukrainians living in areas occupied by Russia have reported to the BBC about the hardships they face, including restrictions on freedom, scarcity of essential goods, and constant fear of military actions. The testimonies highlight the challenges of daily life in these regions, underscoring the impact of the occupation on civilians.
titles: 'Russians are even trying to ban our holidays' - women speak out from occupied Ukraine

title: US special envoy meets Putin as Trump urges Russia to 'get moving' on Ukraine ceasefire
snippets: Steve Witkoff held talks with the Russian president, meanwhile Moscow's ambassador to the UK told the BBC the US is not Russia's ally.
summary: Steve Witkoff engaged in discussions with the Russian president. Concurrently, Moscow's ambassador to the UK communicated to the BBC that the United States is not considered an ally of Russia. This information reflects the current state of relations and interactions involving these parties.
titles: US special envoy meets Putin as Trump urges Russia to 'get moving' on Ukraine ceasefire

title: How has the war in Ukraine divided Western countries?
snippets: The US is pushing for a quick end to Russia's war as Europeans are increasing their military aid to Kyiv.
summary: The US is advocating for a rapid conclusion to the conflict initiated by Russia, while European nations are escalating their military support for Kyiv. This approach aims to bolster Ukraine's defense capabilities against the ongoing aggression.
titles: How has the war in Ukraine divided Western countries?

title: Tanzania’s main opposition Chadema party barred from upcoming elections
snippets: A treason charge and the exclusion of the main opposition draw attention before October polls in Tanzania.
summary: In Tanzania, ahead of the October elections, the main opposition party faces significant challenges, including a treason charge against one of its leaders and the party's exclusion from the polls. This situation has raised concerns about the fairness and inclusiveness of the upcoming electoral process.
titles: Tanzania’s main opposition Chadema party barred from upcoming elections

title: CCTV captures moment of explosion in central Athens
snippets: There have been no reported injuries, as Greece's transport minister condemns the "criminal" attack.
summary: In Greece, an attack targeting the transportation sector has been strongly condemned by the country's transport minister, who labeled the incident as "criminal." Despite the severity of the situation, there have been no reported injuries resulting from this event.
titles: CCTV captures moment of explosion in central Athens

title: Bryson DeChambeau is trying to chase down Rory McIlroy again in a major. He has 18 holes to do it
snippets: Bryson DeChambeau finds himself trying to chase down Rory McIlroy in another major championship.  DeChambeau and McIlroy had a chance to briefly stare each other down during the third round Saturday, too.
summary: Bryson DeChambeau is competing against Rory McIlroy in a major championship, aiming to overtake him. During the third round on Saturday, both golfers had an opportunity for a brief confrontation. This event marks another instance of DeChambeau attempting to surpass McIlroy in a significant tournament setting.
titles: Bryson DeChambeau is trying to chase down Rory McIlroy again in a major. He has 18 holes to do it

title: 'I'm still here': Bryson DeChambeau birdies his way into final pairing at 2025 Masters
snippets: Bryson DeChambeau refused to let Rory McIlroy make it a one-horse race for the final round of the 2025 Masters at Augusta National. Now he's part of a final pairing that has golf fans elated for Sunday.
summary: Bryson DeChambeau challenged Rory McIlroy's lead in the 2025 Masters at Augusta National, securing a spot in the final pairing. Their competition has heightened anticipation for Sunday's concluding round among golf enthusiasts.
titles: 'I'm still here': Bryson DeChambeau birdies his way into final pairing at 2025 Masters

title: Masters 2025 final round tee times, pairings: Rory McIlroy and Bryson DeChambeau are in the final group Sunday at Augusta National
snippets: Rory McIlroy and Bryson DeChambeau will be in the final group on Sunday with a green jacket on the line.
summary: Rory McIlroy and Bryson DeChambeau are set to compete in the final group on Sunday, with the winner receiving a green jacket. This event marks a significant moment in the tournament, highlighting both players' achievements leading up to this final round.
titles: Masters 2025 final round tee times, pairings: Rory McIlroy and Bryson DeChambeau are in the final group Sunday at Augusta National

title: Masters 2025: Final-round tee times, pairings for Sunday at Augusta National
snippets: Tee times and groupings for the final round of the 89th Masters Tournament
summary: The final round of the 89th Masters Tournament has announced its tee times and groupings. Participants and spectators can now view the schedule and matchups for the concluding round of the competition. This organization allows for the strategic planning for both players and fans, setting the stage for the tournament's climax.
titles: Masters 2025: Final-round tee times, pairings for Sunday at Augusta National

title: Defending champion Scottie Scheffler fails to make a move, trails by 7 shots entering final round
snippets: The door was open all day for Scottie Scheffler.  The defending Masters champion failed to take advantage time and time again, leaving him seven shots behind leader Rory McIlroy with a round left in his bid to join Jack Nicklaus as the only players to win three green jackets in a four-year span.  Scheffler wasn’t particularly sharp Saturday and failed to give himself many birdie opportunities.
summary: Defending Masters champion Scottie Scheffler struggled in his performance, failing to capitalize on opportunities, which left him seven shots behind the leader, Rory McIlroy, with one round remaining. Scheffler's aim to match Jack Nicklaus's record of winning three green jackets in four years was compromised as he did not create sufficient birdie chances on Saturday.
titles: Defending champion Scottie Scheffler fails to make a move, trails by 7 shots entering final round

title: Trump exempts smartphones from ‘reciprocal’ tariffs after market rout
snippets: Dispensation is first sign of softening of levies against China and provides a big boost for Apple
summary: The U.S. government has begun to soften its tariff policies against China, marking a significant shift by granting dispensations. This change has notably benefited Apple, providing a substantial boost to the company. This move is the first sign of easing in the previously stringent levies imposed on Chinese imports.
titles: Trump exempts smartphones from ‘reciprocal’ tariffs after market rout

title: British Steel nationalisation is ‘likely option’, says business secretary
snippets: MPs vote in favour of bill giving the government powers to seize control of British Steel
summary: British MPs have voted in favor of a bill that grants the government the authority to take control of British Steel. This move is aimed at potentially safeguarding the future of the steel industry within the UK. The outcome of the vote means that the government now has the legal power to intervene and manage the company's operations if deemed necessary.
titles: British Steel nationalisation is ‘likely option’, says business secretary

title: The midlife non-crisis
snippets: Why the middle years are better than youth and old age
summary: Research indicates that middle age, often considered a period of stability and achievement, can be more fulfilling than both youth and old age. This phase is characterized by greater emotional well-being, financial stability, and a deeper understanding of personal goals and relationships. Studies suggest that individuals in their middle years are better equipped to handle life's challenges, leading to a higher level of life satisfaction compared to the often tumultuous youth and the physical and cognitive declines associated with old age.

title: Gold enjoys best week in five years as investors rush to safety
snippets: Even US Treasuries take a hit as Donald Trump’s tariff blitz shakes confidence in American assets
summary: US Treasuries, typically seen as stable investments, experienced a decline in value as President Donald Trump's implementation of tariffs led to decreased confidence in American financial assets. This situation reflects the broader impact of the tariff policy on the perception of US economic stability.
titles: Gold enjoys best week in five years as investors rush to safety

title: Wall Street Is Souring on the S&P 500—Here's Where Forecasters See Stocks Ending the Year
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • More than half of Wall Street's major stock market forecasters have slashed their outlook for the S&P 500 in recent weeks amid turmoil sparked by President Trump's tariffs.
  • Confusion and uncertainty about the economic outlook have caused the gap between the Street's highest and lowest year-end S&P 500 forecasts to widen significantly.
  • The average year-end estimate from firms that have updated their year-end forecasts suggests Wall Street is now expecting stocks to decline slightly this year rather than post a third straight year of gains.


President Trump’s tariffs haven’t just rattled the stock market; they’ve also made it nearly impossible to estimate where stocks are headed.

Stock volatility jumped to fresh heights when President Trump on Wednesday, just hours after sweeping “reciprocal” tariffs went into effect, announced a 90-day pause to most of the charges. The pause sparked the S&P 500’s biggest rally since 2008 days after the index suffered its worst rout since 2020. 

The president’s unpredictable and unprecedented trade policy has amplified uncertainty among investors, businesses, and consumers, leading to sharp declines in each group’s economic confidence. 

Wall Street analysts have responded by slashing their stock market forecasts. Four major firms—Bank of America, Evercore ISI, Oppenheimer, and JPMorgan Chase—cut their targets on Monday before tariffs were paused. Bank of America and Evercore both lowered their year-end S&P 500 forecasts to 5,600 from 6,666 and 6,800, respectively. Oppenheimer cut its forecast by more than 16% to 5,950. JPMorgan became the most bearish of them all when it slashed its S&P 500 target to 5,200 from 6,500. 

The uncertainty stemming from tariffs hasn’t just weighed on expectations; it has also made forecasting more difficult and contributed to a widening gulf between Wall Street’s optimists and pessimists. At the start of 2025, the 14 firms tracked by CNBC’s Market Strategist Survey were projecting the S&P 500 would end the year anywhere between 6,500 and 7,100. By this week, the delta between the low and high forecasts had tripled in size from 600 points to 1,800 points. Excluding firms that haven't updated their year-end forecasts, the range has still expanded by 50% to 900 points. 

On average, analysts still expect stocks to post a third consecutive positive year. The average forecast of 6,056 is about 3% above the S&P 500's level at the end of 2024 and about 13% above its close on Friday.

However, updated forecasts tell a different story. Excluding firms that have yet to change their forecasts in light of Trump's tariff and the recent sell-off, the average S&P 500 target is just 5,733, nearly 3% below where the index started the year and 7% above its current level.
summary: Over half of Wall Street's major stock market forecasters have reduced their S&P 500 outlooks due to uncertainty caused by President Trump's tariffs. This has led to a significant increase in the forecast range for the year's end, indicating a lack of consensus among analysts. Before the tariffs were paused, firms like Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase lowered their S&P 500 targets substantially. Although the average analyst forecast suggests a slight increase in the S&P 500 by the end of the year, updated forecasts post-tariff pause predict a slight decline from the start of the year, reflec
titles: Wall Street Is Souring on the S&P 500—Here's Where Forecasters See Stocks Ending the Year
